text: I have recurring, unwanted thoughts, images, or urges that cause me anxiety or distress.
I feel compelled to perform repetitive behaviors or mental acts to reduce anxiety or prevent something bad from happening.
I need things to be arranged in a specific order or pattern, and I feel distressed if they're not.
I repeatedly check things like locks, switches, or appliances, even though I know they're already secure.
I have excessive concerns about cleanliness, contamination, or germs.
I feel the need to count, repeat words, or perform actions a specific number of times.
I have intrusive thoughts about harming myself or others, even though I have no intention of doing so.
I need everything to be perfect and feel distressed when things aren't exactly right.
I spend excessive amounts of time on cleaning, organizing, or arranging things.
I have difficulty throwing things away, even when they have no practical value.
I can easily let go of perfectionist tendencies and accept 'good enough' outcomes.
I don't feel compelled to repeat actions or check things multiple times.
I can tolerate uncertainty and don't need everything to be perfectly controlled.
I don't experience intrusive thoughts that cause me significant distress.
I can complete tasks without feeling the need to redo them multiple times.
I feel anxious or distressed when I can't perform my rituals or routines exactly as I need to.
I have obsessive thoughts about symmetry, order, or exactness that interfere with my daily life.
I feel like I'm secretly addicted to perfect control and can't function without it.
My need for control and perfection interferes with my relationships and daily functioning.
I can maintain a healthy balance between order and flexibility in my life.
